name: Puffing Crab
author: cooksalot63
summary: In southern Maryland we eat a lot of crab. This is an interesting way to use any leftover crab meat (we pick our own). I don't remember where I got this recipe. You can also use a good quality canned pasteurized crab meat. Either way, this recipe will wow your guests.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Gradually whisk in flour and cook about 5 minutes (reduce heat if mixture begins to brown)
Slowly whisk in the hot milk and heat until mixture reaches a low boil, stirring constantly
Remove from heat and allow to cool at least 5 minutes (otherwise eggs will cook when added to the mixture)
Stir the beaten egg yolks into the cooled sauce
Add the crabmeat and season with salt, pepper, cayenne, and  ® seasoning if using
Gently fold in the beaten egg whites
Bake until browned and puffy, about 20 minutes
